name: identification
title: Identification
description: A taxonomic determination (i.e., the assignment of dwc:Taxa to dwc:Organisms).

fields.name: identificationID
fields.title: Identification ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Identification.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: basedOnOccurrenceID
fields.title: Based On Occurrence ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Occurrence based on which a dwc:Identification was made.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: basedOnMaterialEntityID
fields.title: Based On Material Entity ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:MaterialEntity based on which a dwc:Identification was made.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: basedOnNucleotideSequenceID
fields.title: Based On Nucleotide Sequence ID
fields.description: An identifier for a NucleotideSequence based on which a dwc:Identification was made.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: basedOnNucleotideAnalysisID
fields.title: Based On Nucleotide Analysis ID
fields.description: An identifier for a NucleotideAnalysis based on which a dwc:Identification was made.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: basedOnMediaID
fields.title: Based On Media ID
fields.description: An identifier for a Media instance based on which a dwc:Identification was made.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: identificationType
fields.title: Identification Type
fields.description: A category that best matches the nature of a dwc:Identification.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: verbatimIdentification
fields.title: Verbatim Identification
fields.description: A string representing a taxonomic identification as it appeared in the original record.
fields.examples: `Ctenomys sociabilis`; `social tuco-tuco`; `Peromyscus sp.`; `Ministrymon sp. nov. 1`; `Anser anser Ã— Branta canadensis`; `Pachyporidae?`

fields.name: isAcceptedIdentification
fields.title: Is Accepted Identification
fields.description: A dwc:Identification of a dwc:Organism is a currently an accepted one.

fields.name: taxonFormula
fields.title: Taxon Formula
fields.description: A string representing the pattern to use to construct a dwc:Identification from dwc:Taxon names and identification qualifiers.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as https://arctos.database.museum/info/ctDocumentation.cfm?table=cttaxa_formula.
fields.examples: `A`; `A ?`; `A or B`; `A and B`; `A x B`; `A cf.`; `A aff.`

fields.name: typeStatus
fields.title: Type Status
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of nomenclatural types (type status, typified scientific name, publication) applied to the subject.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.examples: `holotype of Ctenomys sociabilis. Pearson O. P., and M. I. Christie. 1985. Historia Natural, 5(37):388`; `holotype of Pinus abies | holotype of Picea abies`

fields.name: typeDesignationType
fields.title: typeDesignationType
fields.description: A category that best matches the nature of a type designation.

fields.name: typifiedName
fields.title: Typified Name
fields.description: A scientific name for which a specimen or other name is the type.

fields.name: identifiedBy
fields.title: Identified By
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of Agents responsible for making a taxonomic determination of a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).

fields.name: identifiedByID
fields.title: Identified By ID
fields.description: An identifier for the Agent responsible for making a taxonomic determination of a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to provide a single identifier that disambiguates the details of the identifying agent. If a list is used, the order of the identifiers on the list should not be assumed to convey any semantics. Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).

fields.name: dateIdentified
fields.title: Date Identified
fields.description: A date on which the subject was determined as representing a dwc:Taxon.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.

fields.name: identificationReferences
fields.title: Identification References
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers for References (publication, bibliographic reference, global unique identifier, URI, metabarcoding reference database) used in a dwc:Identification.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `Aves del Noroeste Patagonico. Christie et al. 2004.`; `Stebbins, R. Field Guide to Western Reptiles and Amphibians. 3rd Edition. 2003. | Irschick, D.J. and Shaffer, H.B. (1997). The polytypic species revisited: Morphological differentiation among tiger salamanders (Ambystoma tigrinum) (Amphibia: Caudata). Herpetologica, 53(1), 30-49.` ; `UNITE v10.0, https://doi.org/10.15156/BIO/3301231`

fields.name: taxonAssignmentMethod
fields.title: Taxon Assignment Method
fields.description: Tool and thresholds used to compare sequences when computing 'species-level' OTUs.

fields.name: identificationVerificationStatus
fields.title: Identification Verification Status
fields.description: A categorical indicator of the extent to which a taxonomic determination has been verified to be correct.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as that used in HISPID and ABCD.

fields.name: identificationRemarks
fields.title: Identification Remarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a dwc:Identification.
fields.examples: `Distinguished between Anthus correndera and Anthus hellmayri based on the comparative lengths of the uÃ±as.`

fields.name: taxonID
fields.title: Taxon ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Taxon.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: higherClassificationName
fields.title: Higher Classification Name
fields.description: A full scientific name at a higher rank than the taxonRank of dwc:scientificName.
fields.comments: A higherClassificationName must have a corresponding higherClassificationRank.

fields.name: higherClassificationRank
fields.title: Higher Classification Rank
fields.description: A taxonomic rank of the higherClassificationName.
fields.comments: A higherClassificationRank must have a corresponding higherClassificationName.

fields.name: scientificName
fields.title: Scientific Name
fields.description: A full scientific name, with authorship and date information if known. When forming part of a dwc:Identification, this should be the name in lowest level taxonomic rank that can be determined. This term should not contain identification qualifications, which should instead be supplied in dwc:verbatimIdentification.
fields.examples: `Coleoptera` (order); `Vespertilionidae` (family); `Manis` (genus); `Ctenomys sociabilis` (genus + specificEpithet); `Ambystoma tigrinum diaboli` (genus + specificEpithet + infraspecificEpithet); `Roptrocerus typographi (GyÃ¶rfi, 1952)` (genus + specificEpithet + scientificNameAuthorship); `Quercus agrifolia var. oxyadenia (Torr.) J.T. Howell` (genus + specificEpithet + taxonRank + infraspecificEpithet + scientificNameAuthorship)

fields.name: taxonRank
fields.title: Taxon Rank
fields.description: A taxonomic rank of the most specific name in a dwc:scientificName.

fields.name: taxonRemarks
fields.title: Taxon Remarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a dwc:Taxon.
fields.examples: `This name is a misspelling in common use.`
